page.title: 04Village shops.
page.content: There are six shops in the village of West Haddon. There are two food shops, two antique shops, one pine furniture shop, one clothes shop, and a hairdresser's shop. Of these shops the two food shops are used most often and by most people. As well as selling food one of these shops sells newspapers and it is also the village post office. The two antique shops are both owned by Mr.Hopwood. The clothes shop, called "Matilda's", appears to be used by older rather than younger people in the village. The pine shop has not been open very long but already appears to have attracted a large number of customers especially at the week end.It sells both new and renovated furniture. The hairdresser's is a very useful amenity used by many people.
